summary: Set up Cursor for data science workflows including Python, R, and SQL with notebooks, remote environments, and AI-powered analysis. Cursor supports .ipynb files with full cell execution.
key_takeaways: Install the Jupyter extension (ms-toolsai.jupyter) for full notebook support.
Connect databases through MCP servers for direct querying in Agent.
Use development containers for reproducible environments across teams.
Remote-SSH connections enable access to GPU resources and large datasets.

questions.question: What extension is required for full notebook support in Cursor?
questions.explanation: Download the Jupyter extension (id: ms-toolsai.jupyter) published by ms-toolsai for full notebook support including inline cell execution and AI assistance.

questions.question: What's the difference between using MCP servers vs Extensions for database integration?

options.text: MCP servers let Agents query databases directly; Extensions integrate the broader editor

questions.explanation: MCP servers allow your Agent to make queries directly against your database as part of ongoing tasks. Extensions integrate your broader editor with databases for direct query execution.

questions.question: What file should you commit to version control for sharing development container configurations?

options.text: The .devcontainer folder with devcontainer.json and Dockerfile

questions.explanation: Commit the .devcontainer folder to version control. Team members can rebuild the environment automatically when opening the project, ensuring consistent runtimes and dependencies.
